p.s: The given speech of the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson addressed at COP26 World Leaders' Summit Opening Ceremony is about the need to get real about climate change.
At the beginning of his speech he compares the climate crisis as a tragedy like in James Bond but climate crisis is not a movie, so he says we have to listen to the scientists.
He also mentions that all the promises they made before will all be nothing when we are not getting real about climate change.
Furthermore he addresses to the industrialized countries that they have to help the rest of the world to green technology.
In addition to that he makes clear that we can only succeed against climate change by working together.
He also says that we have the opportunities to change something but the question is if we do not change something the unborn children will judge us and will know that Glasgow was the turning point.
Thus he says we can notcannot let the future generations down.
When we have the opportunities to change something.
So he appeals at the end of the speech that we have the duty to take this opportunities and that we can do it.
